channel.title: Comments on: SSMS Tools PACK, Something Every SQL Server Developer That Uses SSMS Should Have Installed
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Srinika
item.dc:creator: Srinika
item.content:encoded:
It is one of the best tools.
Unfortunately, I cannot get Collapsing functionality work for me üôÅ
I do not get any +/- sign even in the Begin-End.

item.title: By: Azhar Iqbal
item.dc:creator: Azhar Iqbal
item.description: I have added regions please tell me how to remove the regions.<br /> Thanks
item.content:encoded:
I have added regions please tell me how to remove the regions.
Thanks

item.title: By: Azhar Iqbal
item.dc:creator: Azhar Iqbal
item.description: Its very nice and handy tool.

item.title: By: Miguel
item.dc:creator: Miguel
item.description: Great job. Thank you for your dedication
item.content:encoded: Great job. Thank you for your dedication

item.title: By: Ted Krueger (onpnt)
item.dc:creator: Ted Krueger (onpnt)
item.content:encoded:
Ravie, if you mean the registered server type names, go to SSMS Tools and then Window Connection Coloring. You just add the server names in there and assign them colors. Example: mine are green = dev, orange = UAT, red = prod

If you mean the alternating row colors in this blog, that is the site and not in SSMS

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.description: Ravie, what window? are you talking about the border? that is just Aero Glass in Windows 7
item.content:encoded: Ravie, what window? are you talking about the border? that is just Aero Glass in Windows 7

item.title: By: Ravie Sant
item.dc:creator: Ravie Sant
item.description: How did u show that query window with alternate background colors?....plz tell me...
item.content:encoded: How did u show that query window with alternate background colors?….plz tell me…

item.title: By: SonOfKermit
item.dc:creator: SonOfKermit
item.description: Agree 100%, awesome tool - recently upgraded our servers to SQL 2008 Server, as soon as I installed the developer bits on my PC I downloaded and installed SSMS Tools Pack - I can't use SSMS without it now!
item.content:encoded: Agree 100%, awesome tool – recently upgraded our servers to SQL 2008 Server, as soon as I installed the developer bits on my PC I downloaded and installed SSMS Tools Pack – I can’t use SSMS without it now!

item.description: Nice tool - I installed it and recommended to others
